hero.title: About OSBIC International
hero.subtitle: Your trusted partner for business setup and corporate solutions across the GCC and beyond since 2011.

story.heading: Our Story
story.p1: Founded in 2011, OSBIC International has grown from a local consultancy in Muscat, Oman, into one of the GCC’s leading business setup and corporate service providers.With over 15 years of expertise, OSBIC has helped more than 3,000 entrepreneurs, investors, and companies successfully establish and expand their businesses in Oman, the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Bahrain, and other Gulf countries.
story.p2: As a trusted business setup company in Oman, we offer end-to-end corporate services — including commercial registration (CR), company formation, visa and PRO services, and government liaison support.Whether you’re a foreign investor looking to start a new company in Oman or a local entrepreneur seeking to expand across the GCC, OSBIC ensures your setup process is compliant, transparent, and efficient.
story.p3: Today, OSBIC continues to lead as a top-rated business consultancy in Oman, known for transparency, professionalism, and innovation. Our dedicated team ensures every client receives tailored business setup guidance, strategic advice, and seamless support throughout their journey in Oman and beyond.

core.heading: Our Core Principles
core.sub: The foundation of OSBIC’s excellence — our guiding beliefs and commitments.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.text: To simplify business processes and empower entrepreneurs to achieve their goals across the GCC through exceptional service and expertise.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.text: To be the leading business services provider in the region, recognized for innovation, integrity, and customer-centric solutions.

values.title: Our Values
values.text: Excellence, integrity, transparency, and customer satisfaction drive everything we do at OSBIC International.

founder.heading: Meet Our Founder
founder.sub: Leadership that inspires trust, growth, and vision.
founder.name: Abdullah Al-Hasani
founder.bio: Abdullah Al-Hasani is the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of OSBIC International, a leading business setup and corporate services firm based in Muscat, Oman. With over 20 years of experience in business consultancy, investment advisory, and government relations across the GCC, he established OSBIC with a vision to simplify company formation and empower entrepreneurs to grow their businesses in Oman and the wider Gulf region.
founder.bio1: Under his leadership, OSBIC International has become one of the most trusted names in business setup, corporate structuring, and PRO services—recognized for its transparency, innovation, and client-centric approach.

team.heading: Our Experts
team.sub: Experienced professionals committed to delivering excellence.

pro.heading: Oman PRO & Government Relations Specialists
pro.sub: Our dedicated PRO team ensures fast and reliable processing for all government-related services—visa work, documentation, licensing, and more.

group.heading: Meet the Team
group.sub: The dedicated professionals behind OSBIC’s success — driven by passion, expertise, and excellence.

groupCompanies.heading: Part of the OSAN Group
groupCompanies.sub: A network of specialized firms under OSAN Group, offering expertise across accounting, creative, and service industries.

servicesPage.title: Our Services
servicesPage.subtitle: End-to-end business setup and government services for investors and entrepreneurs in Oman.

companyRegistration.title: Company Registration
companyRegistration.desc: Support for CR, trade name, licensing, shareholders & business setup.

visaEmigration.title: Visa & Emigration Services
visaEmigration.desc: Employment, investor, and family visa processing.

ropServices.title: ROP Services
ropServices.desc: Visa stamping, clearance certificates, and vehicle services.

ministryServices.desc: MOCI, Labour, and Municipality registrations & renewals.

additionalServices.title: Additional Services
additionalServices.desc: Accounting, translation, branding, IT setup & more.

company-registration.title: Company Registration
company-registration.overview: We provide complete company setup and Commercial Registration (CR) services in Oman — from trade name reservation to licensing and post-registration management.
benefits: End-to-end support for local and foreign investors
Assistance with MOA drafting and notarization
Expert guidance through Invest Easy and ministry processes

process.description: Select legal entity type (LLC, branch, or establishment).
Reserve a trade name through the Invest Easy portal.
Submit documents and complete shareholder KYC verification.
Obtain Commercial Registration certificate.
Apply for initial and operational licenses as required.

requirements: Shareholder passport copies and contact details
Lease agreement or proof of office address

faqs.question: Can foreigners fully own a company in Oman?
faqs.answer: Yes, 100% foreign ownership is permitted in most activities, except restricted ones.

faqs.question: How long does CR registration take?
faqs.answer: Typically 3–5 business days after submitting complete documents.

visa-emigration.title: Visa & Emigration Services
visa-emigration.overview: Our visa specialists assist investors, employees, and families with all visa and residency applications in Oman — including Golden Visa, Employment Visa, and family sponsorship.
benefits: Full handling of visa and residency applications

process.description: Prepare required documents (passport, medical, photo, etc.).
Apply via Royal Oman Police eVisa or Ministry of Labour portal.
Complete medical test and biometric registration if required.
Receive visa approval and collect Civil ID.

faqs.question: How long does visa processing take?
faqs.answer: Usually 3–7 working days after complete submission.

faqs.question: Can dependents join on my visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, family members can apply under family sponsorship.

rop-services.title: ROP Services
rop-services.overview: We handle all ROP-related formalities including visa stamping, vehicle registration, traffic services, and police clearance certificates.
benefits: Assistance with visa stamping and renewals
Quick processing of police clearance certificates

process.description: Gather all required documents (passport, ID, photos, etc.).
Submit applications via the ROP e-services portal or in person.
Complete biometric verification if required.
Receive approvals and collect your official documents.

faqs.question: Can I apply online for police clearance?
faqs.answer: Yes, ROP’s e-service portal allows online applications for clearance certificates.

faqs.question: Is vehicle registration renewal possible online?
faqs.answer: Yes, through ROP’s official e-services portal.

pro-services.title: PRO Services
pro-services.overview: Our PRO experts handle all government liaison work for your company — including document attestation, ministry visits, license renewals, and visa follow-ups.
benefits: Dedicated PRO handling all government tasks
Save time and avoid queues or delays

process.description: Collect documents for submission (licenses, ID, applications).
Our PRO visits the relevant authority or ministry.
We track and follow up on approvals or renewals.
Receive completed and attested documents.

requirements: Authorization letter or power of attorney
Valid company CR and license copies

faqs.question: Do I need a full-time PRO for my business?
faqs.answer: Not necessarily — we offer on-demand and monthly PRO services as needed.

faqs.question: Can you handle document attestation outside Oman?
faqs.answer: Yes, through our embassy and notary partners.

ministry-services.title: Ministry Services
ministry-services.overview: We assist in all procedures with Oman’s ministries — including MOCI, Ministry of Labour, Municipality, and Chamber of Commerce registrations.
benefits: End-to-end coordination with all major ministries
Labour clearances and work permit management
Municipality license renewals and trade inspections

process.description: Identify the required ministry or department for your service.
Prepare and submit required documents and applications.
Follow up on approvals, renewals, or updates.
Receive final certificates or approvals from the ministry.

requirements: Completed application forms for each ministry

faqs.question: Do I need a physical office to get a municipality license?
faqs.answer: Yes, a valid lease agreement or office address is required.

faqs.question: Can you renew my MOCI license?
faqs.answer: Yes, we handle renewals and updates through Invest Easy or directly at MOCI.

additional-services.title: Additional Business Services
additional-services.overview: We offer additional support for your operations in Oman — including accounting setup, document translation, business consulting, and website or branding assistance.
benefits: Business consulting for expansion and restructuring
Website, domain, and email setup assistance

process.description: Assess your business support needs.
Assign the relevant experts for accounting, legal, or IT setup.
Complete setup of accounts, translation, branding, or website.
Provide final guidance and support for smooth operations.

requirements: Documents to be translated or attested

faqs.question: Can you set up corporate bank accounts for foreign investors?
faqs.answer: Yes, we guide you through bank selection, KYC, and account opening.

faqs.question: Do you provide VAT accounting services?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide full VAT registration and bookkeeping support.

hero.title: Business Setup in Oman
hero.subtitle: End-to-end business setup and government services for investors and entrepreneurs in Oman.

whyChooseOman.title: Why Choose Oman for Your Business?
whyChooseOman.description: Oman offers a unique blend of modern infrastructure, strategic location, and business-friendly policies.
benefits: Strategic location bridging Asia, Africa, and Europe

businessTypes.title: Types of Business Structures
businessTypes.description: Choose the right business structure for your needs.

types.title: Joint Partnership
types.description: A business owned by two or more partners sharing profits, losses, and responsibilities equally or as per agreement.

types.title: Individual Firm / Merchant
types.description: A single-owner business where the individual operates under their trade name, commonly used for small local businesses.

types.title: Limited Partnership
types.description: Includes both general and limited partners, where limited partners have restricted liability based on their investment.

types.title: Limited Liability Company (LLC)
types.description: Most common structure for SMEs in Oman, offering limited liability and flexible ownership options.

types.title: Sole Proprietor Company
types.description: Owned and managed by a single individual who assumes full responsibility for the company’s assets and obligations.

types.title: Closed Joint Stock Company
types.description: A company with shareholders (minimum 3) whose shares are privately held and not publicly traded.

types.title: Public Joint Stock Company
types.description: A larger corporate entity whose shares can be publicly offered, regulated under Omani commercial law.

types.title: Foreign Company Branch
types.description: Allows foreign companies to establish a branch in Oman for executing specific government or private contracts.

types.title: Commercial Representative Office
types.description: Set up mainly for marketing and research purposes, without engaging in direct trading activities.

types.title: Non-Profit Organization
types.description: Formed to support social, charitable, or cultural activities under Omani regulations.

types.title: Freelance
types.description: An individual professional license allowing self-employed individuals to offer services independently.

setupProcess.title: Business Setup Process
setupProcess.description: A simple 5-step process to launch your business in Oman.

steps.title: Business Activity & Name Selection
steps.description: Choose your business activity and reserve your company name with the Ministry of Commerce

steps.title: Documentation Preparation
steps.description: Prepare all required documents including passport copies, NOC, business plan, and articles of association

steps.title: Commercial Registration
steps.description: Submit application and documents to obtain Commercial Registration Certificate

steps.title: License Issuance
steps.description: Receive your trade license and municipal approvals

steps.title: Bank Account & Visa Processing
steps.description: Open corporate bank account and process investor/employee visas

documents: Valid passport copies of all shareholders and directors
Proof of address (utility bill or bank statement)
No Objection Certificate (NOC) from sponsor if required
Board resolution and power of attorney

cta.title: Ready to Start Your Business in Oman?
cta.description: Our expert team will guide you through every step of the process.
